title: Celtic's Logan earns first Scotland Women call-up
shortDescription: Celtic academy graduate Chloe Logan has earned her first Scotland Women's call-up.

title: Griffiths joins Falkirk until end of season
shortDescription: Falkirk have signed former Celtic striker Leigh Griffiths on a deal until the end of the season.

title: 'I'm ready' - Salah tells Klopp to play him against Leicester
shortDescription: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah could be in contention to face Leicester on Thursday only four days after losing the AFCON final with Egypt, Jurgen Klopp has confirmed.

title: Incredible scenes as Senegal team return home
shortDescription: Senegal's victorious football team received a heroes' welcome when they landed back in the capital Dakar, after winning the Africa Cup of Nations for the first time.

title: Eriksen: I knew I'd play again days after incident
shortDescription: Christian Eriksen says that he knew he would play football again just two days after suffering a cardiac arrest at Euro 2020.

title: 'I'm deeply sorry' - Zouma apologises after kicking his cat
shortDescription: The Met Police have decided not to investigate a video which showed West Ham defender Kurt Zouma kicking his cat across his kitchen floor.

title: Rangnick on Martial, Lingard: Better to speak in person, not social media
shortDescription: Ralf Rangnick has revealed he never reads social media and encouraged his Manchester United players to communicate with him in person instead.

title: Man charged with assault after Forest players attacked in cup game
shortDescription: A 19-year-old man has been charged after three Nottingham Forest players were attacked during their 4-1 FA Cup win over Leicester.

title: Orient fan released without charge after arrest for alleged racist abuse
shortDescription: A Leyton Orient supporter has been released without charge after being arrested for alleged racist abuse towards Colchester's Corie Andrews.

title: Ashley 'fully committed' to buying Derby but 'frustrated' by delays
shortDescription: One of Mike Ashley’s senior executives has confirmed the former Newcastle owner is fully committed to buying Derby County, but is frustrated with delays.
